1use std::os::raw::*;
2use std::ptr;
3
4// MAJOR(8b) + MINOR(8b)
5cfg_if! {
6    if #[cfg(feature = "1_1")] {
7        pub const WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION: c_int = 0x0209;
8    } else if #[cfg(feature = "0_5")] {
9        pub const WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION: c_int = 0x0208;
10    } else {
11        pub const WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION: c_int = 0x0203;
12    }
13}
14
15#[cfg(feature = "extern-types")]
16extern "C" {
17    pub type WebPIDecoder;
18}
19
20#[cfg(not(feature = "extern-types"))]
21#[repr(C)]
22pub struct WebPIDecoder(c_void);
23
24// Colorspaces
25// Note: the naming describes the byte-ordering of packed samples in memory.
26// For instance, MODE_BGRA relates to samples ordered as B,G,R,A,B,G,R,A,...
27// Non-capital names (e.g.:MODE_Argb) relates to pre-multiplied RGB channels.
28// RGBA-4444 and RGB-565 colorspaces are represented by following byte-order:
29// RGBA-4444: [r3 r2 r1 r0 g3 g2 g1 g0], [b3 b2 b1 b0 a3 a2 a1 a0], ...
30// RGB-565: [r4 r3 r2 r1 r0 g5 g4 g3], [g2 g1 g0 b4 b3 b2 b1 b0], ...
31// In the case WEBP_SWAP_16BITS_CSP is defined, the bytes are swapped for
32// these two modes:
33// RGBA-4444: [b3 b2 b1 b0 a3 a2 a1 a0], [r3 r2 r1 r0 g3 g2 g1 g0], ...
34// RGB-565: [g2 g1 g0 b4 b3 b2 b1 b0], [r4 r3 r2 r1 r0 g5 g4 g3], ...
35
36#[allow(non_camel_case_types)]
37pub type WEBP_CSP_MODE = u32;
38
39pub const MODE_RGB: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 0;
40pub const MODE_RGBA: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 1;
41pub const MODE_BGR: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 2;
42pub const MODE_BGRA: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 3;
43pub const MODE_ARGB: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 4;
44pub const MODE_RGBA_4444: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 5;
45pub const MODE_RGB_565: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 6;
46// RGB-premultiplied transparent modes (alpha value is preserved)
47#[allow(non_upper_case_globals)]
48pub const MODE_rgbA: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 7;
49#[allow(non_upper_case_globals)]
50pub const MODE_bgrA: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 8;
51#[allow(non_upper_case_globals)]
52pub const MODE_Argb: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 9;
53#[allow(non_upper_case_globals)]
54pub const MODE_rgbA_4444: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 10;
55// YUV modes must come after RGB ones.
56pub const MODE_YUV: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 11;
57pub const MODE_YUVA: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 12;
58pub const MODE_LAST: WEBP_CSP_MODE = 13;
59
60// Some useful macros:
61
62#[allow(non_snake_case)]
63#[inline]
64pub extern "C" fn WebPIsPremultipliedMode(mode: WEBP_CSP_MODE) -> c_int {
65    (mode == MODE_rgbA || mode == MODE_bgrA || mode == MODE_Argb || mode == MODE_rgbA_4444) as c_int
66}
67
68#[allow(non_snake_case)]
69#[inline]
70pub extern "C" fn WebPIsAlphaMode(mode: WEBP_CSP_MODE) -> c_int {
71    (mode == MODE_RGBA
72        || mode == MODE_BGRA
73        || mode == MODE_ARGB
74        || mode == MODE_RGBA_4444
75        || mode == MODE_YUVA
76        || WebPIsPremultipliedMode(mode) != 0) as c_int
77}
78
79#[allow(non_snake_case)]
80#[inline]
81pub extern "C" fn WebPIsRGBMode(mode: WEBP_CSP_MODE) -> c_int {
82    (mode < MODE_YUV) as c_int
83}
84
85//------------------------------------------------------------------------------
86// WebPDecBuffer: Generic structure for describing the output sample buffer.
87
88/// view as RGBA
89#[repr(C)]
90#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
91pub struct WebPRGBABuffer {
92    /// pointer to RGBA samples
93    pub rgba: *mut u8,
94    /// stride in bytes from one scanline to the next.
95    pub stride: c_int,
96    /// total size of the *rgba buffer.
97    pub size: usize,
98}
99
100/// view as YUVA
101#[repr(C)]
102#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
103pub struct WebPYUVABuffer {
104    /// pointer to luma samples
105    pub y: *mut u8,
106    /// pointer to chroma U samples
107    pub u: *mut u8,
108    /// pointer to chroma V samples
109    pub v: *mut u8,
110    /// pointer to alpha samples
111    pub a: *mut u8,
112    /// luma stride
113    pub y_stride: c_int,
114    /// chroma U stride
115    pub u_stride: c_int,
116    /// chroma V stride
117    pub v_stride: c_int,
118    /// alpha stride
119    pub a_stride: c_int,
120    /// luma plane size
121    pub y_size: usize,
122    /// chroma U plane size
123    pub u_size: usize,
124    /// chroma V planes size
125    pub v_size: usize,
126    /// alpha-plane size
127    pub a_size: usize,
128}
129
130/// Output buffer
131#[repr(C)]
132#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
133pub struct WebPDecBuffer {
134    /// Colorspace.
135    pub colorspace: WEBP_CSP_MODE,
136    /// Dimension (width).
137    pub width: c_int,
138    /// Dimension (height).
139    pub height: c_int,
140    /// If non-zero, 'internal_memory' pointer is not
141    /// used. If value is '2' or more, the external
142    /// memory is considered 'slow' and multiple
143    /// read/write will be avoided.
144    pub is_external_memory: c_int,
145    /// Nameless union of buffer parameters.
146    pub u: __WebPDecBufferUnion,
147    /// padding for later use
148    pub pad: [u32; 4],
149    /// Internally allocated memory (only when
150    /// is_external_memory is 0). Should not be used
151    /// externally, but accessed via the buffer union.
152    #[doc(hidden)]
153    pub private_memory: *mut u8,
154}
155
156#[allow(non_snake_case)]
157#[repr(C)]
158#[derive(Clone, Copy)]
159pub union __WebPDecBufferUnion {
160    pub RGBA: WebPRGBABuffer,
161    pub YUVA: WebPYUVABuffer,
162}
163
164impl std::fmt::Debug for __WebPDecBufferUnion {
165    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut std::fmt::Formatter) -> std::fmt::Result {
166        f.write_str("<union>")
167    }
168}
169
170/// Enumeration of the status codes
171#[allow(non_camel_case_types)]
172pub type VP8StatusCode = u32;
173
174pub const VP8_STATUS_OK: VP8StatusCode = 0;
175pub const VP8_STATUS_OUT_OF_MEMORY: VP8StatusCode = 1;
176pub const VP8_STATUS_INVALID_PARAM: VP8StatusCode = 2;
177pub const VP8_STATUS_BITSTREAM_ERROR: VP8StatusCode = 3;
178pub const VP8_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE: VP8StatusCode = 4;
179pub const VP8_STATUS_SUSPENDED: VP8StatusCode = 5;
180pub const VP8_STATUS_USER_ABORT: VP8StatusCode = 6;
181pub const VP8_STATUS_NOT_ENOUGH_DATA: VP8StatusCode = 7;
182
183/// Deprecated alpha-less version of WebPIDecGetYUVA(): it will ignore the
184/// alpha information (if present). Kept for backward compatibility.
185#[allow(non_snake_case)]
186#[inline]
187pub unsafe extern "C" fn WebPIDecGetYUV(
188    idec: *const WebPIDecoder,
189    last_y: *mut c_int,
190    u: *mut *mut u8,
191    v: *mut *mut u8,
192    width: *mut c_int,
193    height: *mut c_int,
194    stride: *mut c_int,
195    uv_stride: *mut c_int,
196) -> *mut u8 {
197    WebPIDecGetYUVA(
198        idec,
199        last_y,
200        u,
201        v,
202        ptr::null_mut(),
203        width,
204        height,
205        stride,
206        uv_stride,
207        ptr::null_mut(),
208    )
209}
210
211/// Features gathered from the bitstream
212#[repr(C)]
213#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
214pub struct WebPBitstreamFeatures {
215    /// Width in pixels, as read from the bitstream.
216    pub width: c_int,
217    /// Height in pixels, as read from the bitstream.
218    pub height: c_int,
219    /// True if the bitstream contains an alpha channel.
220    pub has_alpha: c_int,
221    /// True if the bitstream is an animation.
222    pub has_animation: c_int,
223    /// 0 = undefined (/mixed), 1 = lossy, 2 = lossless
224    pub format: c_int,
225    /// Unused for now. if true, using incremental decoding is not
226    /// recommended.
227    #[cfg(not(feature = "0_5"))]
228    #[deprecated(note = "Removed as of libwebp 0.5.0")]
229    pub no_incremental_decoding: c_int,
230    /// Unused for now. TODO(later)
231    #[cfg(not(feature = "0_5"))]
232    #[deprecated(note = "Removed as of libwebp 0.5.0")]
233    pub rotate: c_int,
234    /// Unused for now. should be 0 for now. TODO(later)
235    #[cfg(not(feature = "0_5"))]
236    #[deprecated(note = "Removed as of libwebp 0.5.0")]
237    pub uv_sampling: c_int,
238    /// padding for later use
239    #[cfg(not(feature = "0_5"))]
240    #[doc(hidden)]
241    pub pad: [u32; 2],
242    /// padding for later use
243    #[cfg(feature = "0_5")]
244    #[doc(hidden)]
245    pub pad: [u32; 5],
246}
247
248/// Decoding options
249#[repr(C)]
250#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
251pub struct WebPDecoderOptions {
252    /// if true, skip the in-loop filtering
253    pub bypass_filtering: c_int,
254    /// if true, use faster pointwise upsampler
255    pub no_fancy_upsampling: c_int,
256    /// if true, cropping is applied _first_
257    pub use_cropping: c_int,
258    /// left position for cropping.
259    /// Will be snapped to even value.
260    pub crop_left: c_int,
261    /// top position for cropping.
262    /// Will be snapped to even value.
263    pub crop_top: c_int,
264    /// width of the cropping area
265    pub crop_width: c_int,
266    /// height of the cropping area
267    pub crop_height: c_int,
268    /// if true, scaling is applied _afterward_
269    pub use_scaling: c_int,
270    /// final resolution width
271    pub scaled_width: c_int,
272    /// final resolution height
273    pub scaled_height: c_int,
274    /// if true, use multi-threaded decoding
275    pub use_threads: c_int,
276    /// dithering strength (0=Off, 100=full)
277    pub dithering_strength: c_int,
278    /// if true, flip output vertically
279    #[cfg(feature = "0_5")]
280    #[cfg_attr(feature = "__doc_cfg", doc(cfg(feature = "0_5")))]
281    pub flip: c_int,
282    /// alpha dithering strength in [0..100]
283    #[cfg(feature = "0_5")]
284    #[cfg_attr(feature = "__doc_cfg", doc(cfg(feature = "0_5")))]
285    pub alpha_dithering_strength: c_int,
286    /// Unused for now. forced rotation (to be applied _last_)
287    #[cfg(not(feature = "0_5"))]
288    #[deprecated(note = "Removed as of libwebp 0.5.0")]
289    pub force_rotation: c_int,
290    /// Unused for now. if true, discard enhancement layer
291    #[cfg(not(feature = "0_5"))]
292    #[deprecated(note = "Removed as of libwebp 0.5.0")]
293    pub no_enhancement: c_int,
294    /// padding for later use
295    #[doc(hidden)]
296    pub pad: [u32; 5],
297}
298
299/// Main object storing the configuration for advanced decoding.
300#[repr(C)]
301#[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
302pub struct WebPDecoderConfig {
303    /// Immutable bitstream features (optional)
304    pub input: WebPBitstreamFeatures,
305    /// Output buffer (can point to external mem)
306    pub output: WebPDecBuffer,
307    /// Decoding options
308    pub options: WebPDecoderOptions,
309}
310
311extern "C" {
312    /// Return the decoder's version number, packed in hexadecimal using 8bits for
313    /// each of major/minor/revision. E.g: v2.5.7 is 0x020507.
314    pub fn WebPGetDecoderVersion() -> c_int;
315    /// Retrieve basic header information: width, height.
316    /// This function will also validate the header, returning true on success,
317    /// false otherwise. '*width' and '*height' are only valid on successful return.
318    /// Pointers 'width' and 'height' can be passed NULL if deemed irrelevant.
319    /// Note: The following chunk sequences (before the raw VP8/VP8L data) are
320    /// considered valid by this function:
321    /// RIFF + VP8(L)
322    /// RIFF + VP8X + (optional chunks) + VP8(L)
323    /// ALPH + VP8 <-- Not a valid WebP format: only allowed for internal purpose.
324    /// VP8(L)     <-- Not a valid WebP format: only allowed for internal purpose.
325    pub fn WebPGetInfo(
326        data: *const u8,
327        data_size: usize,
328        width: *mut c_int,
329        height: *mut c_int,
330    ) -> c_int;
331    /// Decodes WebP images pointed to by 'data' and returns RGBA samples, along
332    /// with the dimensions in *width and *height. The ordering of samples in
333    /// memory is R, G, B, A, R, G, B, A... in scan order (endian-independent).
334    /// The returned pointer should be deleted calling WebPFree().
335    /// Returns NULL in case of error.
336    pub fn WebPDecodeRGBA(
337        data: *const u8,
338        data_size: usize,
339        width: *mut c_int,
340        height: *mut c_int,
341    ) -> *mut u8;
342    /// Same as WebPDecodeRGBA, but returning A, R, G, B, A, R, G, B... ordered data.
343    pub fn WebPDecodeARGB(
344        data: *const u8,
345        data_size: usize,
346        width: *mut c_int,
347        height: *mut c_int,
348    ) -> *mut u8;
349    /// Same as WebPDecodeRGBA, but returning B, G, R, A, B, G, R, A... ordered data.
350    pub fn WebPDecodeBGRA(
351        data: *const u8,
352        data_size: usize,
353        width: *mut c_int,
354        height: *mut c_int,
355    ) -> *mut u8;
356    /// Same as WebPDecodeRGBA, but returning R, G, B, R, G, B... ordered data.
357    /// If the bitstream contains transparency, it is ignored.
358    pub fn WebPDecodeRGB(
359        data: *const u8,
360        data_size: usize,
361        width: *mut c_int,
362        height: *mut c_int,
363    ) -> *mut u8;
364    /// Same as WebPDecodeRGB, but returning B, G, R, B, G, R... ordered data.
365    pub fn WebPDecodeBGR(
366        data: *const u8,
367        data_size: usize,
368        width: *mut c_int,
369        height: *mut c_int,
370    ) -> *mut u8;
371    /// Decode WebP images pointed to by 'data' to Y'UV format(*). The pointer
372    /// returned is the Y samples buffer. Upon return, *u and *v will point to
373    /// the U and V chroma data. These U and V buffers need NOT be passed to
374    /// WebPFree(), unlike the returned Y luma one. The dimension of the U and V
375    /// planes are both (*width + 1) / 2 and (*height + 1) / 2.
376    /// Upon return, the Y buffer has a stride returned as '*stride', while U and V
377    /// have a common stride returned as '*uv_stride'.
378    /// 'width' and 'height' may be NULL, the other pointers must not be.
379    /// Returns NULL in case of error.
380    /// (*) Also named Y'CbCr. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YCbCr
381    pub fn WebPDecodeYUV(
382        data: *const u8,
383        data_size: usize,
384        width: *mut c_int,
385        height: *mut c_int,
386        u: *mut *mut u8,
387        v: *mut *mut u8,
388        stride: *mut c_int,
389        uv_stride: *mut c_int,
390    ) -> *mut u8;
391    // These five functions are variants of the above ones, that decode the image
392    // directly into a pre-allocated buffer 'output_buffer'. The maximum storage
393    // available in this buffer is indicated by 'output_buffer_size'. If this
394    // storage is not sufficient (or an error occurred), NULL is returned.
395    // Otherwise, output_buffer is returned, for convenience.
396    // The parameter 'output_stride' specifies the distance (in bytes)
397    // between scanlines. Hence, output_buffer_size is expected to be at least
398    // output_stride x picture-height.
399    pub fn WebPDecodeRGBAInto(
400        data: *const u8,
401        data_size: usize,
402        output_buffer: *mut u8,
403        output_buffer_size: usize,
404        output_stride: c_int,
405    ) -> *mut u8;
406    pub fn WebPDecodeARGBInto(
407        data: *const u8,
408        data_size: usize,
409        output_buffer: *mut u8,
410        output_buffer_size: usize,
411        output_stride: c_int,
412    ) -> *mut u8;
413    pub fn WebPDecodeBGRAInto(
414        data: *const u8,
415        data_size: usize,
416        output_buffer: *mut u8,
417        output_buffer_size: usize,
418        output_stride: c_int,
419    ) -> *mut u8;
420    // RGB and BGR variants. Here too the transparency information, if present,
421    // will be dropped and ignored.
422    pub fn WebPDecodeRGBInto(
423        data: *const u8,
424        data_size: usize,
425        output_buffer: *mut u8,
426        output_buffer_size: usize,
427        output_stride: c_int,
428    ) -> *mut u8;
429    pub fn WebPDecodeBGRInto(
430        data: *const u8,
431        data_size: usize,
432        output_buffer: *mut u8,
433        output_buffer_size: usize,
434        output_stride: c_int,
435    ) -> *mut u8;
436    /// WebPDecodeYUVInto() is a variant of WebPDecodeYUV() that operates directly
437    /// into pre-allocated luma/chroma plane buffers. This function requires the
438    /// strides to be passed: one for the luma plane and one for each of the
439    /// chroma ones. The size of each plane buffer is passed as 'luma_size',
440    /// 'u_size' and 'v_size' respectively.
441    /// Pointer to the luma plane ('*luma') is returned or NULL if an error occurred
442    /// during decoding (or because some buffers were found to be too small).
443    pub fn WebPDecodeYUVInto(
444        data: *const u8,
445        data_size: usize,
446        luma: *mut u8,
447        luma_size: usize,
448        luma_stride: c_int,
449        u: *mut u8,
450        u_size: usize,
451        u_stride: c_int,
452        v: *mut u8,
453        v_size: usize,
454        v_stride: c_int,
455    ) -> *mut u8;
456    /// Internal, version-checked, entry point
457    #[doc(hidden)]
458    pub fn WebPInitDecBufferInternal(_: *mut WebPDecBuffer, _: c_int) -> c_int;
459    /// Free any memory associated with the buffer. Must always be called last.
460    /// Note: doesn't free the 'buffer' structure itself.
461    pub fn WebPFreeDecBuffer(buffer: *mut WebPDecBuffer);
462    /// Creates a new incremental decoder with the supplied buffer parameter.
463    /// This output_buffer can be passed NULL, in which case a default output buffer
464    /// is used (with MODE_RGB). Otherwise, an internal reference to 'output_buffer'
465    /// is kept, which means that the lifespan of 'output_buffer' must be larger than
466    /// that of the returned WebPIDecoder object.
467    /// The supplied 'output_buffer' content MUST NOT be changed between calls to
468    /// WebPIAppend() or WebPIUpdate() unless 'output_buffer.is_external_memory' is
469    /// not set to 0. In such a case, it is allowed to modify the pointers, size and
470    /// stride of output_buffer.u.RGBA or output_buffer.u.YUVA, provided they remain
471    /// within valid bounds.
472    /// All other fields of WebPDecBuffer MUST remain constant between calls.
473    /// Returns NULL if the allocation failed.
474    pub fn WebPINewDecoder(output_buffer: *mut WebPDecBuffer) -> *mut WebPIDecoder;
475    /// This function allocates and initializes an incremental-decoder object, which
476    /// will output the RGB/A samples specified by 'csp' into a preallocated
477    /// buffer 'output_buffer'. The size of this buffer is at least
478    /// 'output_buffer_size' and the stride (distance in bytes between two scanlines)
479    /// is specified by 'output_stride'.
480    /// Additionally, output_buffer can be passed NULL in which case the output
481    /// buffer will be allocated automatically when the decoding starts. The
482    /// colorspace 'csp' is taken into account for allocating this buffer. All other
483    /// parameters are ignored.
484    /// Returns NULL if the allocation failed, or if some parameters are invalid.
485    pub fn WebPINewRGB(
486        csp: WEBP_CSP_MODE,
487        output_buffer: *mut u8,
488        output_buffer_size: usize,
489        output_stride: c_int,
490    ) -> *mut WebPIDecoder;
491    /// This function allocates and initializes an incremental-decoder object, which
492    /// will output the raw luma/chroma samples into a preallocated planes if
493    /// supplied. The luma plane is specified by its pointer 'luma', its size
494    /// 'luma_size' and its stride 'luma_stride'. Similarly, the chroma-u plane
495    /// is specified by the 'u', 'u_size' and 'u_stride' parameters, and the chroma-v
496    /// plane by 'v' and 'v_size'. And same for the alpha-plane. The 'a' pointer
497    /// can be pass NULL in case one is not interested in the transparency plane.
498    /// Conversely, 'luma' can be passed NULL if no preallocated planes are supplied.
499    /// In this case, the output buffer will be automatically allocated (using
500    /// MODE_YUVA) when decoding starts. All parameters are then ignored.
501    /// Returns NULL if the allocation failed or if a parameter is invalid.
502    pub fn WebPINewYUVA(
503        luma: *mut u8,
504        luma_size: usize,
505        luma_stride: c_int,
506        u: *mut u8,
507        u_size: usize,
508        u_stride: c_int,
509        v: *mut u8,
510        v_size: usize,
511        v_stride: c_int,
512        a: *mut u8,
513        a_size: usize,
514        a_stride: c_int,
515    ) -> *mut WebPIDecoder;
516    /// Deprecated version of the above, without the alpha plane.
517    /// Kept for backward compatibility.
518    pub fn WebPINewYUV(
519        luma: *mut u8,
520        luma_size: usize,
521        luma_stride: c_int,
522        u: *mut u8,
523        u_size: usize,
524        u_stride: c_int,
525        v: *mut u8,
526        v_size: usize,
527        v_stride: c_int,
528    ) -> *mut WebPIDecoder;
529    /// Deletes the WebPIDecoder object and associated memory. Must always be called
530    /// if WebPINewDecoder, WebPINewRGB or WebPINewYUV succeeded.
531    pub fn WebPIDelete(idec: *mut WebPIDecoder);
532    /// Copies and decodes the next available data. Returns VP8_STATUS_OK when
533    /// the image is successfully decoded. Returns VP8_STATUS_SUSPENDED when more
534    /// data is expected. Returns error in other cases.
535    pub fn WebPIAppend(idec: *mut WebPIDecoder, data: *const u8, data_size: usize)
536        -> VP8StatusCode;
537    /// A variant of the above function to be used when data buffer contains
538    /// partial data from the beginning. In this case data buffer is not copied
539    /// to the internal memory.
540    /// Note that the value of the 'data' pointer can change between calls to
541    /// WebPIUpdate, for instance when the data buffer is resized to fit larger data.
542    pub fn WebPIUpdate(idec: *mut WebPIDecoder, data: *const u8, data_size: usize)
543        -> VP8StatusCode;
544    /// Returns the RGB/A image decoded so far. Returns NULL if output params
545    /// are not initialized yet. The RGB/A output type corresponds to the colorspace
546    /// specified during call to WebPINewDecoder() or WebPINewRGB().
547    /// *last_y is the index of last decoded row in raster scan order. Some pointers
548    /// (*last_y, *width etc.) can be NULL if corresponding information is not
549    /// needed. The values in these pointers are only valid on successful (non-NULL)
550    /// return.
551    pub fn WebPIDecGetRGB(
552        idec: *const WebPIDecoder,
553        last_y: *mut c_int,
554        width: *mut c_int,
555        height: *mut c_int,
556        stride: *mut c_int,
557    ) -> *mut u8;
558    /// Same as above function to get a YUVA image. Returns pointer to the luma
559    /// plane or NULL in case of error. If there is no alpha information
560    /// the alpha pointer '*a' will be returned NULL.
561    pub fn WebPIDecGetYUVA(
562        idec: *const WebPIDecoder,
563        last_y: *mut c_int,
564        u: *mut *mut u8,
565        v: *mut *mut u8,
566        a: *mut *mut u8,
567        width: *mut c_int,
568        height: *mut c_int,
569        stride: *mut c_int,
570        uv_stride: *mut c_int,
571        a_stride: *mut c_int,
572    ) -> *mut u8;
573    /// Generic call to retrieve information about the displayable area.
574    /// If non NULL, the left/right/width/height pointers are filled with the visible
575    /// rectangular area so far.
576    /// Returns NULL in case the incremental decoder object is in an invalid state.
577    /// Otherwise returns the pointer to the internal representation. This structure
578    /// is read-only, tied to WebPIDecoder's lifespan and should not be modified.
579    pub fn WebPIDecodedArea(
580        idec: *const WebPIDecoder,
581        left: *mut c_int,
582        top: *mut c_int,
583        width: *mut c_int,
584        height: *mut c_int,
585    ) -> *const WebPDecBuffer;
586    /// Internal, version-checked, entry point
587    #[doc(hidden)]
588    pub fn WebPGetFeaturesInternal(
589        _: *const u8,
590        _: usize,
591        _: *mut WebPBitstreamFeatures,
592        _: c_int,
593    ) -> VP8StatusCode;
594    /// Internal, version-checked, entry point
595    #[doc(hidden)]
596    pub fn WebPInitDecoderConfigInternal(_: *mut WebPDecoderConfig, _: c_int) -> c_int;
597    /// Instantiate a new incremental decoder object with the requested
598    /// configuration. The bitstream can be passed using 'data' and 'data_size'
599    /// parameter, in which case the features will be parsed and stored into
600    /// config->input. Otherwise, 'data' can be NULL and no parsing will occur.
601    /// Note that 'config' can be NULL too, in which case a default configuration
602    /// is used. If 'config' is not NULL, it must outlive the WebPIDecoder object
603    /// as some references to its fields will be used. No internal copy of 'config'
604    /// is made.
605    /// The return WebPIDecoder object must always be deleted calling WebPIDelete().
606    /// Returns NULL in case of error (and config->status will then reflect
607    /// the error condition, if available).
608    pub fn WebPIDecode(
609        data: *const u8,
610        data_size: usize,
611        config: *mut WebPDecoderConfig,
612    ) -> *mut WebPIDecoder;
613    /// Non-incremental version. This version decodes the full data at once, taking
614    /// 'config' into account. Returns decoding status (which should be VP8_STATUS_OK
615    /// if the decoding was successful). Note that 'config' cannot be NULL.
616    pub fn WebPDecode(
617        data: *const u8,
618        data_size: usize,
619        config: *mut WebPDecoderConfig,
620    ) -> VP8StatusCode;
621}
622
623/// Initialize the structure as empty. Must be called before any other use.
624/// Returns false in case of version mismatch
625#[allow(non_snake_case)]
626#[inline]
627pub unsafe extern "C" fn WebPInitDecBuffer(buffer: *mut WebPDecBuffer) -> c_int {
628    WebPInitDecBufferInternal(buffer, WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION)
629}
630
631/// Retrieve features from the bitstream. The *features structure is filled
632/// with information gathered from the bitstream.
633/// Returns VP8_STATUS_OK when the features are successfully retrieved. Returns
634/// VP8_STATUS_NOT_ENOUGH_DATA when more data is needed to retrieve the
635/// features from headers. Returns error in other cases.
636/// Note: The following chunk sequences (before the raw VP8/VP8L data) are
637/// considered valid by this function:
638/// RIFF + VP8(L)
639/// RIFF + VP8X + (optional chunks) + VP8(L)
640/// ALPH + VP8 <-- Not a valid WebP format: only allowed for internal purpose.
641/// VP8(L)     <-- Not a valid WebP format: only allowed for internal purpose.
642#[allow(non_snake_case)]
643#[inline]
644pub unsafe extern "C" fn WebPGetFeatures(
645    data: *const u8,
646    data_size: usize,
647    features: *mut WebPBitstreamFeatures,
648) -> VP8StatusCode {
649    WebPGetFeaturesInternal(data, data_size, features, WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION)
650}
651
652/// Initialize the configuration as empty. This function must always be
653/// called first, unless WebPGetFeatures() is to be called.
654/// Returns false in case of mismatched version.
655#[allow(non_snake_case)]
656#[inline]
657pub unsafe extern "C" fn WebPInitDecoderConfig(config: *mut WebPDecoderConfig) -> c_int {
658    WebPInitDecoderConfigInternal(config, WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION)
659}
